snippet: Rebels who captured what had been a tolerant and easygoing city in northern Mali have imposed hard-edged Islamic rule, prompting many residents to flee.
abstract: Rebels who captured Timbuktu in northern Mali have imposed strict Islamic rule, prompting many residents to flee in fear and changing the face of what had been a tolerant and easygoing destination that drew tourists from around the world; the look of the ancient mud-brick town is changing, as signs with Koranic messages replace advertisements, music is banned and women are forced to wear full veils.
lead_paragraph: Rebels who captured what had been a tolerant and easygoing city in northern Mali have imposed hard-edged Islamic rule, prompting many residents to flee.

headline.seo: In Timbuktu, Mali Rebels and Islamists Impose Harsh Rule
headline.main: In Timbuktu, Harsh Change Under Islamists
headline.print_headline: In Timbuktu, Harsh Change Under Islamists
